result.execSummary:
The defendant Juwon S. Brown was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property fr. Person/Corpse [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Repeater], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Use of a Dangerous Weapon, Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to Ct 2. Remaining amount of 501 days credit to be applied.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program. 
++ Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
++   Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given. May not associate with gangs/gang members or gang affiliations.  May Not have contact with:  NO contact with Tamika or her residence.

Total Incarceration                                                    5 years  0 months

Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the State.  Def. appeared with Atty John Cabranes.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Amended Information filed amending Count 1 to Felony Theft from Person, PTAC, Repeater.  Count 2 remains the same.   Plea of no contest to both counts; found guilty by the Court.  Presentence investigation ordered.  Sentencing 11/28/16/16 at 2:00.  Bond continued.

Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the State.  Def. appeared with Atty John Cabranes.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  State has located their complaining witness, who is willing to testify at trial.  Jury status hearing 6/16/16 at 1:00.   Jury trial 6/20/16 at 8:30 (3 days).  Bond continued.

Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney John Cabranes.  Clerk: PT
Atty Graveley states they were unable to locate victim for trial today due to an active felony warrant out of Racine for victim.  Atty Graveley has had numerous conversations with victim prior to the warrant and has no objection to releasing DE from custody, but requests case not be dismissed.  Atty Cabranes moves to dismiss case.  Upon hearing arguments motion to dismiss is denied.  Court amends bond to a $20,000 Signature Bond with same conditions and DE signs bond in court.  Status conference scheduled for April 7, 2016 at 08:40 am.

*No Weapons.  *No Contact w/Eltag A. A, Dashai L. B-Y, Lazeric R. M, Tamika B, or any of their residences.

records.addlTxt: Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State. Def. Lazeric Maxey appeared with Atty. Andrea Rufo; Def. Eltag Abusam appeared with Atty. Jerold Breitenbach; Def. Dashai Brown-Young appeared with Atty. Brett Ekes; Def. Juwon Brown appeared with Atty. David Celebre. Clerk LE. Preliminary hearings held jointly in 14CF1260/14CF1261/14CF1262/14CF1263. KPD Det. Daniel DeJong sworn in and testified on behalf of the State. Cross-examination by Atty. Breitenbach. Cross-examination by Atty. Celebre. Cross-examination by Atty. Rufo. Cross-examination by Atty. Ekes. Probable cause found. Request for substitution of Judge Schroeder filed by Attys. Rufo, Breitenbach, Ekes, and Celebre. Tab pulled for Judge Kerkman. Bound over to Br. 8. Information filed, plea of not guilty. Judicial pretrial on 1-13-15 @ 8:30am with co-defs. Bond continued.
